description: Describes an Amazon Managed Workflows for Apache Airflow (MWAA) environment.

parameters.name: Name
parameters.description: The name of the Amazon MWAA environment. For example, MyMWAAEnvironment.

nested_items.name: Environment
nested_items.description: An object containing all available details about the environment.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the Amazon MWAA environment. For example, MyMWAAEnvironment.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The status of the Amazon MWAA environment.
CREATING - Indicates the request to create the environment is in progress.

CREATING_SNAPSHOT - Indicates the request to update environment details, or upgrade the environment version, is in progress and Amazon MWAA is creating a storage volume snapshot of the Amazon RDS database cluster associated with the environment. A database snapshot is a backup created at a specific point in time. Amazon MWAA uses snapshots to recover environment metadata if the process to update or upgrade an environment fails.
CREATE_FAILED - Indicates the request to create the environment failed, and the environment could not be created.
AVAILABLE - Indicates the request was successful and the environment is ready to use.

PENDING - Indicates the request was successful, but the process to create the environment is paused until you create the required VPC endpoints in your VPC. After you create the VPC endpoints, the process resumes.
UPDATING - Indicates the request to update the environment is in progress.
ROLLING_BACK - Indicates the request to update environment details, or upgrade the environment version, failed and Amazon MWAA is restoring the environment using the latest storage volume snapshot.
DELETING - Indicates the request to delete the environment is in progress.
DELETED - Indicates the request to delete the environment is complete, and the environment has been deleted.
UNAVAILABLE - Indicates the request failed, but the environment did not return to its previous state and is not stable.
UPDATE_FAILED - Indicates the request to update the environment failed, and the environment was restored to its previous state successfully and is ready to use.

MAINTENANCE - Indicates that the environment is undergoing maintenance. Depending on the type of work Amazon MWAA is performing, your environment might become unavailable during this process. After all operations are done, your environment will return to its status prior to mainteneace operations.

nested_items.name: Arn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon MWAA environment.

nested_items.name: CreatedAt
nested_items.description: The day and time the environment was created.

nested_items.name: WebserverUrl
nested_items.description: The Apache Airflow web server host name for the Amazon MWAA environment. For more information, see Accessing the Apache Airflow UI.

nested_items.name: ExecutionRoleArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the execution role in IAM that allows MWAA to access Amazon Web Services resources in your environment. For example, arn:aws:iam::123456789:role/my-execution-role. For more information, see Amazon MWAA Execution role.

nested_items.name: ServiceRoleArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the service-linked role of the environment. For more information, see Amazon MWAA Service-linked role.

nested_items.name: KmsKey
nested_items.description: The KMS encryption key used to encrypt the data in your environment.

nested_items.name: AirflowVersion
nested_items.description: The Apache Airflow version on your environment.

nested_items.name: SourceBucketArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon S3 bucket where your DAG code and supporting files are stored. For example, arn:aws:s3:::my-airflow-bucket-unique-name. For more information, see Create an Amazon S3 bucket for Amazon MWAA.

nested_items.name: DagS3Path
nested_items.description: The relative path to the DAGs folder in your Amazon S3 bucket. For example, s3://mwaa-environment/dags. For more information, see Adding or updating DAGs.

nested_items.name: PluginsS3Path
nested_items.description: The relative path to the file in your Amazon S3 bucket. For example, s3://mwaa-environment/plugins.zip. For more information, see Installing custom plugins.

nested_items.name: PluginsS3ObjectVersion
nested_items.description: The version of the plugins.zip file in your Amazon S3 bucket. You must specify the version ID that Amazon S3 assigns to the file.

nested_items.name: RequirementsS3Path
nested_items.description: The relative path to the requirements.txt file in your Amazon S3 bucket. For example, s3://mwaa-environment/requirements.txt. For more information, see Installing Python dependencies.

nested_items.name: RequirementsS3ObjectVersion
nested_items.description: The version of the requirements.txt file on your Amazon S3 bucket. You must specify the version ID that Amazon S3 assigns to the file.

nested_items.name: StartupScriptS3Path
nested_items.description: The relative path to the startup shell script in your Amazon S3 bucket. For example, s3://mwaa-environment/startup.sh.

nested_items.name: StartupScriptS3ObjectVersion
nested_items.description: The version of the startup shell script in your Amazon S3 bucket. You must specify the version ID that Amazon S3 assigns to the file.

nested_items.name: AirflowConfigurationOptions
nested_items.description: A list of key-value pairs containing the Apache Airflow configuration options attached to your environment. For more information, see Apache Airflow configuration options.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: EnvironmentClass
nested_items.description: The environment class type. Valid values: mw1.micro, mw1.small, mw1.medium, mw1.large, mw1.xlarge, and mw1.2xlarge. For more information, see Amazon MWAA environment class.

nested_items.name: MaxWorkers
nested_items.description: The maximum number of workers that run in your environment. For example, 20.

nested_items.name: NetworkConfiguration
nested_items.description: Describes the VPC networking components used to secure and enable network traffic between the Amazon Web Services resources for your environment. For more information, see About networking on Amazon MWAA.

nested_items.name: SubnetIds
nested_items.description: A list of subnet IDs. For more information, see About networking on Amazon MWAA.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: SecurityGroupIds
nested_items.description: A list of security group IDs. For more information, see Security in your VPC on Amazon MWAA.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: LoggingConfiguration
nested_items.description: The Apache Airflow logs published to CloudWatch Logs.

nested_items.name: DagProcessingLogs
nested_items.description: The Airflow DAG processing logs published to CloudWatch Logs and the log level.

nested_items.name: Enabled
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the Apache Airflow log type (e.g. DagProcessingLogs) is enabled.

nested_items.name: LogLevel
nested_items.description: The Apache Airflow log level for the log type (e.g. DagProcessingLogs).

nested_items.name: CloudWatchLogGroupArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the CloudWatch Logs group where the Apache Airflow log type (e.g. DagProcessingLogs) is published. For example, arn:aws:logs:us-east-1:123456789012:log-group:airflow-MyMWAAEnvironment-MwaaEnvironment-DAGProcessing:*.

nested_items.name: SchedulerLogs
nested_items.description: The Airflow scheduler logs published to CloudWatch Logs and the log level.

nested_items.name: Enabled
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the Apache Airflow log type (e.g. DagProcessingLogs) is enabled.

nested_items.name: LogLevel
nested_items.description: The Apache Airflow log level for the log type (e.g. DagProcessingLogs).

nested_items.name: CloudWatchLogGroupArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the CloudWatch Logs group where the Apache Airflow log type (e.g. DagProcessingLogs) is published. For example, arn:aws:logs:us-east-1:123456789012:log-group:airflow-MyMWAAEnvironment-MwaaEnvironment-DAGProcessing:*.

nested_items.name: WebserverLogs
nested_items.description: The Airflow web server logs published to CloudWatch Logs and the log level.

nested_items.name: Enabled
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the Apache Airflow log type (e.g. DagProcessingLogs) is enabled.

nested_items.name: LogLevel
nested_items.description: The Apache Airflow log level for the log type (e.g. DagProcessingLogs).

nested_items.name: CloudWatchLogGroupArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the CloudWatch Logs group where the Apache Airflow log type (e.g. DagProcessingLogs) is published. For example, arn:aws:logs:us-east-1:123456789012:log-group:airflow-MyMWAAEnvironment-MwaaEnvironment-DAGProcessing:*.

nested_items.name: WorkerLogs
nested_items.description: The Airflow worker logs published to CloudWatch Logs and the log level.

nested_items.name: Enabled
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the Apache Airflow log type (e.g. DagProcessingLogs) is enabled.

nested_items.name: LogLevel
nested_items.description: The Apache Airflow log level for the log type (e.g. DagProcessingLogs).

nested_items.name: CloudWatchLogGroupArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the CloudWatch Logs group where the Apache Airflow log type (e.g. DagProcessingLogs) is published. For example, arn:aws:logs:us-east-1:123456789012:log-group:airflow-MyMWAAEnvironment-MwaaEnvironment-DAGProcessing:*.

nested_items.name: Enabled
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the Apache Airflow log type (e.g. DagProcessingLogs) is enabled.

nested_items.name: LogLevel
nested_items.description: The Apache Airflow log level for the log type (e.g. DagProcessingLogs).

nested_items.name: CloudWatchLogGroupArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the CloudWatch Logs group where the Apache Airflow log type (e.g. DagProcessingLogs) is published. For example, arn:aws:logs:us-east-1:123456789012:log-group:airflow-MyMWAAEnvironment-MwaaEnvironment-DAGProcessing:*.

nested_items.name: LastUpdate
nested_items.description: The status of the last update on the environment.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The status of the last update on the environment.

nested_items.name: CreatedAt
nested_items.description: The day and time of the last update on the environment.

nested_items.name: ErrorCode
nested_items.description: The error code that corresponds to the error with the last update.

nested_items.name: ErrorMessage
nested_items.description: The error message that corresponds to the error code.

nested_items.name: Source
nested_items.description: The source of the last update to the environment. Includes internal processes by Amazon MWAA, such as an environment maintenance update.

nested_items.name: WorkerReplacementStrategy
nested_items.description: The worker replacement strategy used in the last update of the environment.

nested_items.name: WeeklyMaintenanceWindowStart
nested_items.description: The day and time of the week in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) 24-hour standard time that weekly maintenance updates are scheduled. For example: TUE:03:30.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: WebserverAccessMode
nested_items.description: The Apache Airflow web server access mode. For more information, see Apache Airflow access modes.

nested_items.name: MinWorkers
nested_items.description: The minimum number of workers that run in your environment. For example, 2.

nested_items.name: Schedulers
nested_items.description: The number of Apache Airflow schedulers that run in your Amazon MWAA environment.

nested_items.name: WebserverVpcEndpointService
nested_items.description: The VPC endpoint for the environment's web server.

nested_items.name: DatabaseVpcEndpointService
nested_items.description: The VPC endpoint for the environment's Amazon RDS database.

nested_items.name: CeleryExecutorQueue
nested_items.description: The queue ARN for the environment's Celery Executor. Amazon MWAA uses a Celery Executor to distribute tasks across multiple workers. When you create an environment in a shared VPC, you must provide access to the Celery Executor queue from your VPC.

nested_items.name: EndpointManagement
nested_items.description: Defines whether the VPC endpoints configured for the environment are created, and managed, by the customer or by Amazon MWAA. If set to SERVICE, Amazon MWAA will create and manage the required VPC endpoints in your VPC. If set to CUSTOMER, you must create, and manage, the VPC endpoints in your VPC.

nested_items.name: MinWebservers
nested_items.description: The minimum number of web servers that you want to run in your environment. Amazon MWAA scales the number of Apache Airflow web servers up to the number you specify for MaxWebservers when you interact with your Apache Airflow environment using Apache Airflow REST API, or the Apache Airflow CLI. As the transaction-per-second rate, and the network load, decrease, Amazon MWAA disposes of the additional web servers, and scales down to the number set in MinxWebserers.

nested_items.name: MaxWebservers
nested_items.description: The maximum number of web servers that you want to run in your environment. Amazon MWAA scales the number of Apache Airflow web servers up to the number you specify for MaxWebservers when you interact with your Apache Airflow environment using Apache Airflow REST API, or the Apache Airflow CLI. For example, in scenarios where your workload requires network calls to the Apache Airflow REST API with a high transaction-per-second (TPS) rate, Amazon MWAA will increase the number of web servers up to the number set in MaxWebserers. As TPS rates decrease Amazon MWAA disposes of the additional web servers, and scales down to the number set in MinxWebserers.
